They also didn't even have close to 3000 health. It just did damage around that number. They wouldn't have had more than like what, 1000-1500 health or so in the first place for it to do that much damage.

The slow gives Jhin a way to start fights (similar to an Ashe/Sivir/Kalista ult) even when he's behind. It's also pretty easy to counter the ult, since you know where he is, can hear when he shoots, and your teammates can block the shots. 

If Jhin isn't ahead, his first 3 shots will do pretty negligible damage onto targets built to take them (each shot at max rank does 200 + 25% AD and when you factor in armor, it's pretty meh damage) and his 4th shot still does little damage if your team can juggle the shots between tanks. It's meant to be an engage/pick tool for your team to follow up with and has the power to 100-0 squishy targets if they're stupid or alone.

If you want to get rid of the slow, you have to give him plenty of power to compensate by either increasing his root on the W, increasing vision length off his ult, or just flat out increasing the damage.
